Question: HashMap with key and value equal the values of two other hashmaps using Java: :I have two hashmaps and I would like to fill a third hashmap which keys will be the values of the first hash map and the values will be the values of the second hashmap splitted to an array.i.e.:hashmap1 = {1=e1, 2=e2}hashmap2 = {10=word1-word2-word3, 20=word4-word5-word6}the result:hashmap3 = {e1=word1-word2-word3, e2=word4-word5-word6}This is what I did so far:  static HashMap<Integer, String> catnamecatkeys = new HashMap<Integer, String>();    static HashMap<Integer, String> keywords = new HashMap<Integer, String>();    static HashMap<String, String> tempHash = new HashMap<String, String>();    static HashMap<String, String[]> hash = new HashMap<String, String[]>();    static String[] arr;    public static void main(String[] args) {    catnamecatkeys.put(1, "e1");    catnamecatkeys.put(2, "e2");    keywords.put(1, "word1-word2-word3");    keywords.put(2, "word4-word5-word6");    for (int key : catnamecatkeys.keySet()) {        tempHash.put(catnamecatkeys.get(key),null);    }    for(String tempkey: tempHash.keySet()){                  tempHash.put(tempkey,keywords.entrySet().iterator().next().getValue());        arr = tempHash.get(tempkey).split("-");        hash.put(tempkey, arr);    }    System.out.println(tempHash);    for (String hashkey : hash.keySet()) {        for (int i = 0; i < arr.length; i++) {            System.out.println(hashkey + ":" + hash.get(hashkey)[i]);        }       }    }but the output is:hashmap3 = {e1=word1-word2-word3, e2=word1-word2-word3}Any Ideas please?
Please using this api: Map.get.

Question: HashMap with key and value equal the values of two other hashmaps using Java: :I have two hashmaps and I would like to fill a third hashmap which keys will be the values of the first hash map and the values will be the values of the second hashmap splitted to an array.i.e.:hashmap1 = {1=e1, 2=e2}hashmap2 = {10=word1-word2-word3, 20=word4-word5-word6}the result:hashmap3 = {e1=word1-word2-word3, e2=word4-word5-word6}This is what I did so far:  static HashMap<Integer, String> catnamecatkeys = new HashMap<Integer, String>();    static HashMap<Integer, String> keywords = new HashMap<Integer, String>();    static HashMap<String, String> tempHash = new HashMap<String, String>();    static HashMap<String, String[]> hash = new HashMap<String, String[]>();    static String[] arr;    public static void main(String[] args) {    catnamecatkeys.put(1, "e1");    catnamecatkeys.put(2, "e2");    keywords.put(1, "word1-word2-word3");    keywords.put(2, "word4-word5-word6");    for (int key : catnamecatkeys.keySet()) {        tempHash.put(catnamecatkeys.get(key),null);    }    for(String tempkey: tempHash.keySet()){                  tempHash.put(tempkey,keywords.entrySet().iterator().next().getValue());        arr = tempHash.get(tempkey).split("-");        hash.put(tempkey, arr);    }    System.out.println(tempHash);    for (String hashkey : hash.keySet()) {        for (int i = 0; i < arr.length; i++) {            System.out.println(hashkey + ":" + hash.get(hashkey)[i]);        }       }    }but the output is:hashmap3 = {e1=word1-word2-word3, e2=word1-word2-word3}Any Ideas please?

Answer: <<<api>>>: Map.get
<<<code>>>: tempHash.get(tempkey)
<<<explanation>>>: This line of code is used to get the value of the key 'tempkey' from the hashmap 'tempHash'.

Question: How to split the value of the hashmap 'tempHash' into an array using Java:

Answer: <<<api>>>: String.split
<<<code>>>: arr = tempHash.get(tempkey).split("-");
<<<explanation>>>: The String.split() method in Java is used to split a string into an array of strings. In this case, it is used to split the value of the hashmap 'tempHash' at each hyphen (-). The result is stored in the array 'arr'.

Question: How to put the array 'arr' into the hashmap 'hash' using Java:

Answer: <<<api>>>: HashMap.put
<<<code>>>: hash.put(tempkey, arr);
<<<explanation>>>: The HashMap.put() method in Java is used to insert a key-value pair into the hashmap 'hash'. The key is 'tempkey' and the value is the array 'arr'.

Question: How to print the elements of the hashmap 'hash' in Java:

Answer: <<<api>>>: HashMap.get
<<<code>>>: hash.get(hashkey)
<<<explanation>>>: The HashMap.get() method in Java is used to get the value of a specific key from the hashmap 'hash'. This is done by passing the key 'hashkey' as the argument.

Question: How to iterate over the elements of the array 'arr' in Java:

Answer: <<<api>>>: for loop
<<<code>>>: for (int i = 0; i < arr.length; i++)
<<<explanation>>>: The for loop in Java is used to iterate over the elements of an array. In this case, it is used to iterate over the elements of the array 'arr'. The variable 'i' is used as the index to access each element of the array.

Question: How to print each element of the array 'arr' in Java:

Answer: <<<api>>>: System.out.println
<<<code>>>: System.out.println(hashkey + ":" + hash.get(hashkey)[i]);
<<<explanation>>>: The System.out.println() method in Java is used to print a line to the console. In this case, it is used to print each element of the array 'arr'. The elements are printed in the format 'hashkey:element', where 'hashkey' is the key from the hashmap 'hash' and 'element' is an element from the array 'arr'.

Question: How to replace the value of the key 'tempkey' in the hashmap 'tempHash' with the value of the key 'keywords' in the hashmap 'keywords' using Java:

Answer: <<<api>>>: HashMap.put
<<<code>>>: tempHash.put(tempkey, keywords.get(key));
<<<explanation>>>: The HashMap.put() method in Java is used to insert a key-value pair into the hashmap 'tempHash'. The key is 'tempkey' and the value is the value of the key 'key' from the hashmap 'keywords'.

Question: How to iterate over the keys of the hashmap 'keywords' in Java:

Answer: <<<api>>>: HashMap.keySet
<<<code>>>: for (int key : keywords.keySet())
<<<explanation>>>: The HashMap.keySet() method in Java is used to get a set view of the keys contained in this hashmap. This set is backed by the hashmap, so changes to the hashmap are reflected in the set, and vice-versa. The for loop is used to iterate over the keys of the hashmap 'keywords'. The variable 'key' is used as the key for each iteration.

Question: How to get the value of the key 'key' from the hashmap 'keywords' using Java:
